backend/main.mo: Main actor defining Movie type and implementing CRUD operations for movies and user watchlists using Map and List data structures, with preupgrade hook seeding sample movies.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that converts legacy userLists from Set-based storage to List-based storage for compatibility with the new actor structure.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting five implemented features related to error handling, loading states, and debugging for the React frontend application.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of all frontend source files describing their purpose and functionality across components, pages, hooks, and configuration.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables defining light and dark theme color tokens using OKLCH color system for Netflix-inspired styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with root div and script tag loading the React application from main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component configuring TanStack Router with three routes (home, movie detail, my list), wrapped in ErrorBoundary, ThemeProvider, and Suspense with loading fallback.
frontend/src/components/ErrorBoundary.ts: React error boundary class component that catches rendering errors, logs them to console, and displays a user-friendly error UI with reload button.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Hero banner component displaying featured movie with backdrop image, title, metadata, gradient overlays, and action buttons for reading recap or viewing more info.
frontend/src/components/HeroSkeleton.tsx: Skeleton loading placeholder for the hero section with animated background and content placeholders matching the hero layout.
frontend/src/components/MovieCard.tsx: Movie card component with poster image, hover overlay showing title/metadata, and add-to-list button that navigates to detail page on click.
frontend/src/components/MovieRow.tsx: Displays a horizontal scrollable row of movie cards with a title and left/right navigation arrows that appear on hover.
frontend/src/components/MovieRowSkeleton: Loading skeleton component that displays placeholder cards while movie row data is being fetched.
frontend/src/components/Navbar.tsx: Fixed navigation bar with logo, navigation links (Home, My List), search button, user icon, and mobile menu; changes background on scroll.
frontend/src/components/SearchModal.tsx: Modal dialog for searching movies with a text input and grid display of results; navigates to movie detail page on click.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and manages the backend actor with Internet Identity authentication, invalidating dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context provider and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation.
frontend/src/hooks/useMyList.ts: Custom hook that provides functions to check, add, remove, and toggle movies in the user's list using underlying query hooks.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Collection of React Query hooks for fetching all movies, searching movies, getting individual movies, and managing user's movie list with mutations.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with Netflix-inspired dark theme color palette using OKLCH color space and custom scrollbar hiding utilities.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query client and Internet Identity provider, then renders the App component.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Main homepage component that displays a hero section and movie rows organized by genre. Seeds sample movie data on first load if the database is empty, using useGetAllMovies and useAddMovie hooks.
frontend/src/pages/MovieDetailPage.tsx: Movie detail page that displays full movie information including backdrop image, metadata (year, genre, duration), and the complete recap script. Includes 'Add to My List' functionality and back navigation.
frontend/src/pages/MyListPage.tsx: Displays user's saved movies in a grid layout with remove functionality. Shows empty state when list is empty and allows navigation to individual movie detail pages.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom Netflix-themed color palette (blacks, grays, red), extended animations, shadows, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata tracking implemented features, architectural notes, and known issues including blank screen on deployment and CSP errors on Internet Computer. Documents Netflix-like UI/UX requirements and existing feature implementations.
